result.execSummary:
The defendant LUIS A GUZMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: - Court grants the defendant 103 days of sentence credit for TIME SERVED.

- Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel - TO BE DETERMINED upon receipt of the final invoice. AMENDED 05/13/2022 - Court Appointed Atty Fees are $420.00. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.
- Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. LUIS A GUZMAN

records.addlTxt: Invoice for Ct Appt'd Atty Fees - $420.00 (Atty Barb Pierce)         (05/09 approved by the Court)

ADDRESS INFO for LUIS A GUZMAN
Current: 106 E Moore St, Berlin, WI 54923 United States  (Effective: 05-04-2022)
Prior: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States

4:03 PM Defendant LUIS A GUZMAN in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce in court for LUIS A GUZMAN. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 2 with time served, costs and DNs sample and count 1 will be dismissed and read-in. DA concurs. Atty Pierce concurs. Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty on count 2 and orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Pierce. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-90 days days of county jail. Court grants the defendant 103 days of sentence credit for TIME SERVED.
-Court costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 
-Re-pay the costs for court appointed counsel.

Court adjourned at 4:07 PM
Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant LUIS A GUZMAN in court, in custody.  Attorney Matt McElroy in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Barbara Pierce in court for LUIS A GUZMAN. Statement by Atty Pierce, has not had ther chance to discuss the prelim with the defendant. Court sets for Preliminary hearing on May 3, 2022 at 4:00 PM (1/2 hr)
Inmate Request to the Court (DENIED)

1:00 PM Defendant LUIS A GUZMAN appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for Luis A. Guzman, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Statement by Attorney Kapelis. Court sets bond at $2500 cash bond and conditions of: NO CONTACT with victim or victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. 

Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing Feb 1, 2022 3:00 PM. status of counsel Jan 31, 2022 at 1:00 PM.
